meanings.definition: To have or retain possession of
meanings.sent1: She keeps her favorite book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He keeps his keys in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel keeps its acorns hidden from others.
meanings.sent4: The old tree keeps its secrets buried deep within.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student keeps all her notes organized in a binder.

meanings.definition: To continue in a specified state, position, or activity
meanings.sent1: The clock keeps ticking throughout the night.
meanings.sent2: The river keeps flowing steadily towards the sea.
meanings.sent3: The little engine keeps chugging up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The music keeps playing in the background of our lives.
meanings.sent5: The sun keeps shining brightly in the sky every day.

meanings.definition: To provide for the sustenance of
meanings.sent1: The farmer keeps his animals well-fed and happy.
meanings.sent2: She keeps her plants watered regularly.
meanings.sent3: The baker keeps the town supplied with fresh bread.
meanings.sent4: The mother bird keeps her chicks warm under her wings.
meanings.sent5: The chef keeps the customers satisfied with delicious meals.

meanings.sent1: The refrigerator keeps the fruits and vegetables crisp.
meanings.sent2: The airtight container keeps the cookies from going stale.
meanings.sent3: The freezer keeps the ice cream cold and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum-sealed bag keeps the coffee beans aromatic.
meanings.sent5: The pantry keeps the canned goods safe from pests.

meanings.definition: To fulfill or observe (a promise, law, or custom)
meanings.sent1: He keeps his word and always follows through on his promises.
meanings.sent2: She keeps the tradition of baking cookies every Christmas.
meanings.sent3: The town keeps the lawns neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: The community keeps the peace by resolving conflicts peacefully.
meanings.sent5: The team keeps the spirit of sportsmanship alive in every game.
